benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered: Valid Request: TC01 demonstrates successful update with 204 and data persisted
Non-Existing Resource: TC06, TC07, TC12 demonstrate 404/Not Found scenarios including empty DB
Concurrency Issues: TC17 tests concurrent updates and ensures final state consistency
Partial Update: TC23 validates updating with only required fields succeeds
Error Handling: Tests cover missing required header (TC03), invalid IDs (TC04, TC05), missing body (TC09), malformed JSON (TC10), and inconsistent/invalid state data (TC08)
Authorization: TC11 covers 401 Unauthorized when credentials are missing or invalid
Security Testing: TC18 (SQL injection) and TC19 (XSS) to ensure input sanitization and prevention
Additional Payload Handling: TC13 (ignored extra fields), TC24 (header combos), TC25 (extra query parameters), TC26 (header whitespace/case variations)
Edge Cases and Mismatches: TC27 mismatched IDs across payments; TC27 ensures proper error handling
Dependencies/Resilience: TC16 timeouts; TC22 degraded dependent service with resilience strategy
Performance and Regression: TC21 bulk load; TC20 regression test
gaps: 500 Internal Server Error: No test simulates an unexpected server-side failure (500)
Forbidden/Insufficient Privileges: No test for 403 Forbidden when user lacks required admin privileges beyond authentication
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for handling multiple requests in rapid succession regarding quotas
Large Payloads: No explicit test for extremely large payloads beyond "maximum allowed" fields
Caching Behavior: PUT typically updates server state; no tests around caching headers or ETag for this operation
recommendations: Add a test simulating a 500 Internal Server Error and verifying proper error handling
Add a test for 403 Forbidden when an authenticated user lacks necessary admin privileges
Add rate limiting tests to verify throttling and graceful degradation under load
Add tests for large JSON payloads beyond previous max-length boundaries
If caching is relevant for this endpoint, add tests around caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for PUT responses or validations
